meanings.definition: A gunfight or battle in which people shoot at each other.
meanings.sent1: The shootout between the cowboys was intense.
meanings.sent2: The police were involved in a shootout with the criminals.
meanings.sent3: The shootout in the movie had everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The shootout of words between the politicians was fierce.
meanings.sent5: The shootout in the video game felt so real.

meanings.definition: A decisive contest or competition that is resolved by a shootout.
meanings.sent1: The soccer match ended in a shootout to determine the winner.
meanings.sent2: The tiebreaker shootout was nerve-wracking for both teams.
meanings.sent3: The shootout in the spelling bee was unexpected but exciting.
meanings.sent4: The shootout in the final round determined the champion.
meanings.sent5: The shootout in the game show kept viewers on the edge of their seats.
